title: Mobile-first responsive UI for Dashboard and Entries

requirements.summary: Make Dashboard and Entries layouts mobile-first responsive with improved spacing, typography scaling, and touch-friendly controls
acceptanceCriteria: On phone-sized viewports (320–430px), all primary screens (Dashboard, Entries) render without horizontal scrolling.
Tap targets (primary buttons, navigation buttons, action icons) are comfortably clickable on touch devices (no cramped icon clusters).
Page padding/margins are adjusted so content does not feel overly wide/tall on mobile (e.g., reduce desktop-oriented vertical padding where appropriate).

file_operations.description: Adjust global layout spacing for mobile-first: reduce main vertical padding on small screens, ensure main content uses full width without overflow, and tune footer spacing to avoid excessive vertical padding on phones.

Update Dashboard page typography and spacing for small screens (e.g., responsive heading sizes, card grid behavior, and content spacing) to remain readable and comfortable at 320–430px widths using composed shadcn-ui Card primitives. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Update Entries page typography and spacing for small screens so the page header and sections read well and avoid overly large desktop-oriented spacing.

Make the add-entry form mobile-friendly: improve grid stacking, input/control spacing, and touch target sizing (buttons, popovers) on small screens using composed shadcn-ui Button/Input/Textarea/Popover/Calendar components. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Improve period selector mobile ergonomics: ensure controls wrap cleanly, increase tap target sizes on small screens, and prevent overflow within the Card content using composed shadcn-ui Button/Popover/Calendar components. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add small-screen friendly base adjustments (e.g., safe default overflow handling and consistent tap/typography feel) without changing shadcn-ui component source files; keep changes limited to global base styles and utilities.

requirements.summary: Improve mobile navigation and sticky header behavior so navigation is always accessible and never overlaps content
acceptanceCriteria: On small screens, the header and the existing mobile navigation controls remain visible/accessible and do not cause layout overflow.
Navigation controls on mobile clearly indicate the current page and remain usable with one hand (buttons span available width appropriately).

file_operations.description: Refine header layout for small screens: prevent logo/title/login overflow (allow wrapping where needed), ensure sticky behavior remains reliable, and make the mobile nav buttons larger and clearly active (add accessible current-page indication) using composed shadcn-ui Button. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure main content spacing accounts for the sticky header on mobile so content never appears overlapped or clipped during scroll/navigation transitions.

requirements.summary: Adapt the Entries list for mobile with a card/stacked layout while keeping edit/delete actions and filters usable
acceptanceCriteria: On small screens, the entries list does not render as an unreadable multi-column table; instead it uses a mobile-friendly layout (such as stacked rows/cards) that shows date, type, amount, and optional category/note clearly.
Edit and delete actions remain available for each entry on mobile without requiring precision tapping.
Existing filters (type and date range) remain usable on mobile, with controls sized and laid out appropriately.

file_operations.description: Create a mobile-only entries presentation (stacked cards/rows) that displays date, type, amount, and optional category/note, and includes large, touch-friendly edit/delete controls (reusing existing EditEntryDialog/DeleteEntryConfirmDialog triggers) using composed shadcn-ui Card/Button/Badge primitives. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Update EntriesTable to render mobile filters with touch-friendly sizing and to switch between the existing table on larger screens and the new EntriesMobileList on small screens (avoid horizontal scrolling). Keep edit/delete capabilities and existing filter logic intact, composing shadcn-ui Table/Popover/Calendar components without modifying files under frontend/src/components/ui. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
